div.ab: It is promptly made if you put the filings, well cleaned & washed, in an iron case, two fingers high & covered, & redden it thus in a reverberatory furnace, having washed it in good vinegar for the space of a day. And it will be well burnt & clean, mixed and ground finely on marble. Being well ground & once it is quite fine, the vinegar will bite it quite easily & will soon give it redness & bond, wetting it with the strongest you can find & next setting it aflame. And in three or 4 bedewings & ignitions it will be ready. This one is columbine color & is found firmer for casting than that which is redder & the color of minium bole, made of rusty filings, & has more tincture. Others burn the filings several times on a reddened iron shovel, showering it each time with vinegar.
